conclusion: Velocity selector condition for the first particle
Electric and magnetic forces balance for the first particle: qE = qvB ⇒ E = vB
Relation between accelerating voltage U and the velocity v gained in accelerator M
First particle's velocity after acceleration: ½mv² = qU ⇒ v = √(2qU/m)
Forces on the second particle inside the selector
Net lateral force on the second particle: F = q(E – uB), vertical acceleration a = F/(2m)
Geometry of the selector (plate length ℓ and gap width d)
Time in region for first particle: t₁ = ℓ / v
Time in region for second particle: t₂ = ℓ / u, vertical deflection: ½a t₂² = d
Equations: (i) E = vB; (ii) v = √(2qU/m); (iii) a = q(E – uB)/(2m); (iv) ½[q(E – uB)/(2m)] (ℓ/u)² = d
Eliminate E and ℓ, solve for u: u² = v² + (4dBq/m)
Kinetic energy of the second particle when it leaves N
Calculate kinetic energy: E_k = ½(2m)u² = m u² = m[v² + (4dBq/m)] = m v² + 4dBq
Insert v² = 2qU/m into kinetic energy equation: E_k = m(2qU/m) + 4dBq = 2qU + 4dBq
Final kinetic energy of the second particle: E_k = 2qU + 4qBd
